Joining us now is the author of "Why We Fight," Fox News security strategist, Sebastian Gorka, and former Obama economic adviser Austan Goolsbee. Austan, you know, I want to go to you first.

utterances.speaker: AUSTAN GOOLSBEE, FORMER BARACK OBAMA CHIEF ECONOMIST
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: So, OK. So, you remember what he said to the inner-city, to African-Americans what do you have to lose. And now, African-American unemployment the lowest in history. And I'm not going to repeat all the numbers. Please tell me how are you going to say that Donald Trump is not a good president at least for the economy?

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.utterance: Well, I'm kind of surprised that you are choosing today's job number because today's job number was actually a whiff; it was almost 40,000 below what was expected and this by almost 20 percent

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Well, that's expectations, that doesn't mean it's not a plus.

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.utterance: A 157,000 is OK. Now if we had this conversation last Friday I would be totally on board with you, that we had a great GDP job growth number.

utterances.speaker: SEBASTIAN GORKA, FOX NEWS NATIONAL SECURITY STRATEGIST
utterances.utterance: The economy tank this last month--

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Are we just going to say--

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.utterance: And the president should be proud of that number.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK. Austan, I know you have a tough job tonight but we're going to have to go after you. OK. Sebastian, hit it.

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: Can't we just be happy for all Americans, just for once? I mean, really, the New York Times has to hire races for its editorial board, I get it. But let's talk about the economy. Let's get back into the real world. I've just read your book, you know the president, you've known him a long time. He wants success for all Americans. This is all the left doesn't get it. I worked for him. I took the job with him for one reason because he doesn't care if you voted for him or not. You could have wanted Bernie to be president or you may have voted for Hillary, but he wants you to succeed. He wants you to be safe and he wants you to prosper. That's the president. And the left will never believe it, judge.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Well, let me ask you this, Austan, when the Democrats start running, and they are running now obviously for 2018 which is why the president has already started this push. I mean, how do they -- do they just ignore the economy, or do they talk about maybe ISIS is coming back? What do they say?

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.utterance: I think what they would say is the numbers you quoted where you said four million people have gotten a raise. There's 150 million workers in the country. If you look at job creation rates or wage growth, both of those have actually slowed down in the 18 months that we've been under Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Wait a minute. Wait a minute.

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.utterance: So I think they'll probably highlight those facts.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK. And do you think that America -- and I'm going to let Sebastian answer that. Do you think America actually agrees with Nancy about, it's just crumbs? It's just crumbs. Would they rather not see extra money in their paychecks?

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: After you, Austan.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Austan?

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.utterance: I thought you said Sebastian.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: No, I said I'll go to Sebastian--

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.utterance: Yes. They would like to see more money in their paychecks. They haven't. Their corporate profits are at record levels as the share of GDP, and the wage share of the economy is the lowest that it's ever been.

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: OK. Let's get down to brass tacks.

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.utterance: That part is not -- Trump should emphasize that growth is fast and the Democrats will emphasize that wages have not been going up.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Well, they have. Go ahead, Sebastian.

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: So I just want to know what Austan and his cadre, say to the fact that we have the lowest minority unemployment since record-keeping began? You can't spin that. You can't say, well, the growth has decelerated. Who cares, Austan.

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.utterance: That's great.

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: We have oil companies, thanks to the unleashing of the ANWR. We have oil companies that are giving $25,000 signing bonuses in America. That is -- and that is an economy unleashed. How can you not be happy to see the unemployment figures? How can you -- we have basically functional zero unemployment.

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.utterance: I am.

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: We have more jobs available than people looking for jobs? How do you spin that Austan?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Go ahead, Austan.

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.utterance: We've had 115 months of private sector jobs creation, the longest streak ever. About 18 of those months were under Donald Trump and all the rest were under Barack Obama.

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: It's Obama, right. It's Obama.

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.utterance: And it's great, I'm totally for it.

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: The man who couldn't get 3 percent GDP growth ever.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Ever. The American have the worse unemployment under an African- American president.

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.utterance: Donald Trump has not had an annual growth rate of 3 percent either.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Say it again, Austan?

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.utterance: Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: So you are saying we don't have 4.1 percent GDP growth rate?

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.utterance: Donald Trump has not had an annual growth rate of 3 percent.

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: So what's the latest 4.1 percent figure, that's just fantasy?

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.utterance: That is for one quarter.

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.utterance: And you know, Sebastian, it happened four different times under Barack Obama.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes, but you know what? Here's the problem, Austan. Barack Obama had us convinced that 1 percent GDP was the new normal.

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Those bozos actually believed it. Now we're at 4.1 you want to say maybe it won't last but--

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.utterance: That's completely not correct.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: It is correct. Sebastian Gorka and Austan Goolsbee, next Friday. Same time.

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.utterance: The economy to grow, 100 percent for it. If we can have 4 percent growth permanently that will be great.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Thank you both. OK. I'm going to hold you to it. Joining us now with more reaction, our Florida Republican Congressmen Ron DeSantis and Matt Gaetz. All right. Good evening, gentlemen or congressman. I'll start with you, Ron DeSantis. All right. So you are running for governor in Florida. All kinds of great things are being -- are happening with economy and Donald Trump. So when you run in Florida, do people in Florida care about?

utterances.speaker: REP. RON DESANTIS, R-FLORIDA
utterances.utterance: Absolutely, judge. I mean, we had a good run here in Florida during Rick Scott's tenure, and now with the president is doing, particularly the tax reform. Because, and Jeanine, you probably this. You will know this when you file your taxes in New York by getting rid of the deductions for the high tax states. That is going to influence a lot of people to pick up and come to Florida. Particularly if you're in industries like financial services where you can be here. So I think we are primed to really capitalize off of a lot of the good things the presidents has done. I mean, I think Florida has probably never been in a better position as long as we keep good solid low tax fiscally responsible policies.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: All right. Congressman Matt Gaetz, you're from Florida also. You just heard Austin Goolsbee talk about the economy. As though, it's not going to -- you know, don't believe your lying eyes. You kind of like Peter Strzok when he testified before you guys in Congress. Don't believe your lying eyes. What do you say to the Democrats and how is that going to affect the 2018 election? Do you think the Americans are going to believe them?

utterances.speaker: REP. MATT GAETZ, R-FLORIDA
utterances.utterance: Well, they should. If the Democrats take over congress the head of the financial services committee will be Maxine Waters. And letting Maxine Waters anywhere near the economy is about as dumb as putting Hillary Clinton in charge of your I.T. department at your small business. Look, right now we've GDP growth that's doubling. We've got the fastest wage growth in 10 years. We've got home values that are rising at twice that rate and we have had the longest consecutive streak of job growth in American history. Just saying it, judge, it makes me -- it's so exhausting it almost makes me tired of winning.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: All right. And Congressman DeSantis, you know, one of the things the president was talking yesterday or last night in Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania, he talked about the fact that he got NATO to step up and, you know, he said to Melania as he related to the crowd, you know, he said, Melania, he said tomorrow morning, $200 billion, they're going to love it. And you know, they responded with, you know, he was rude to our NATO allies. In the end, this midterm election, which way is it going?

utterances.speaker: DESANTIS
utterances.utterance: Well look, judge, I think it should go Republicans way. I mean, you know, historically there is a reaction against the party in power, but I think the combination of a strong economy and the fact that the Democratic Party doesn't have any ideas, most of their grassroots seem to be gravitating toward socialism, like you see with the Ocasio-Cortez in New York, that's not a winning strategy for places like Florida and other swing states. So, as long as we stay on message, as long as we keep articulating an agenda, there're going to be a positive contrast for us with the Democratic Party that's exhausted of ideas.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: All right. And Matt, what about socialism and, you know, America was stunned with the woman here, Ocasio-Cortez, a socialist supporting -- and I'm not sure she is willing to fully admit that, but supported by the Democrats' socialist association. Where -- are the Democrats upset with that sector of the party? Because if you are not as left as they are, then chances are, I would think that a lot of the more moderate Democrats would either not come out or a vote differently. I'm not sure how to look at that.

utterances.speaker: GAETZ
utterances.utterance: Well, Jeanine, the dynamic you just described is precisely why there are so many Democrats in the rust belt who are part of Donald Trump's winning coalition. We welcome Democrats who want more prosperity. If you want Nancy Pelosi and Maxine Waters in charge, if you want them to rob America of the successes we've enjoyed during Donald Trump's tenure, then I guess, vote Democrat. But in Florida we share like freedom that's probably why we're going to elect Ron DeSantis, our next governor, and we want to make sure in our state that we're poised to take advantage of this roaring economy that we've created with the lower taxes, deregulation. And really trusting the American people to drive their own prosperity so that we're not dependent on government for multiple generations. We become excited and really engineered for success in the long term.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK. Congressman DeSantis, last question. Tom Fitton was just on, they now have evidence that Christopher Steele got paid 11 times in cash by the FBI. What say you?

utterances.speaker: DESANTIS
utterances.utterance: Well, look, we suspected he had been paid. They didn't give us straight answers. Then we figured out he definitely was paid and now this, so I think it further undermines the credibility of the explanations we've been giving. And it shows they knew or should have known that Steele was working on behalf of the Democratic Party, and to pay him like that and then funnel it through from Bruce Ohr, that's a big problem with how this whole thing was done.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes. But you know what, it's about time that Rod Rosenstein and his gang and the rest of them are made accountable, but who knows if that will ever happen. Thank you, congressmen. And coming up, the midterm election is less than 100 days away. Are Democrats going too far to the left to secure votes? Doug Schoen and Deneen Borelli are next. And remember, you can get a copy of my new book, "Liars, Leakers and Liberals," wherever books are sold. We'll be right back.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: You know who the new star, you know who that new leader is? Maxine Waters.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Very low I.Q. Low I.Q. No, no, Maxine Waters is like, she's like their new star.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Welcome back to the special edition of Hannity. That was President Trump last night revealing who he thinks is the new leader of the Democratic Party. It is a far left going too far this midterm season? Joining us now with reaction, Fox News contributor, Deneen Borelli, Fox News contributor and former Clinton pollster, Doug Schoen. All right, good. I'm going to start with a quick question.

utterances.speaker: DOUG SCHOEN, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: Sure.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Is Maxine the new face of the Democratic Party or leader?

utterances.speaker: SCHOEN
utterances.utterance: Well, I hope not, I don't think she is. But candidly with her and people like Ocasio-Cortez who is just nominated in a secure Democratic district, we have people who are engaging in just resistance and socialism as prominent, and are hopefully not leaders of the Democratic Party.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK. What do you think, Deneen, is Maxine Waters the new face of the Democratic Party?

utterances.speaker: DENEEN BORELLI, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: She definitely is, judge. And congratulations on your new book.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: BORELLI
utterances.utterance: Listen, Max -- yes. Maxine's agenda has nothing to do with Americans working and families being well. Her agenda really is to impeach President Trump. She said that any chance she gets. She calls the tax cuts, tax scams.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: BORELLI
utterances.utterance: And let me tell you why she is doing all of this. I think the Democrats are very desperate right now, black voters' support for President Trump is on the rise. So I see and expect more of this rhetoric from her.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Al right. Now just so our viewers in case they've been under a rock, I want you to see Maxine.

utterances.speaker: REP. MAXINE WATERS, D-CALIFORNIA
utterances.utterance: And with this kind of inspiration, I will go and take Trump out tonight. Unveil the criminal activity, the unconstitutional activity of this president and his family. So I have dubbed them the criminal clan a long time ago. I will fight every day until he is impeached. Impeach 45. This is a bunch of scumbags, that's what they are.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Those are very strong words, congressman.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.utterance: Who are all organized around making money? The fact that he has wrapping his arms around Putin, while Putin is continuing to advance into Korea.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Doug?

utterances.speaker: SCHOEN
utterances.utterance: Well, but the only thing that is true there if you read the front page of the Wall Street Journal today, the Russians are doing nothing to restrain North Korea and that's a problem. The rest of what she said is just a load of garbage and I just think as a Democrat I completely distance and disassociate myself from it.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OB. But unfortunately, you've got the likes of Maxine and Nancy. You both seen to be flipping their lids, and then you've got -- and I'll go to you with this, Deneen, and then you've got Ocasio-Cortez. Is the Democratic Party that historically will win the midterms in the first term of any new president, are they so fractured that they are not going to win?

utterances.speaker: BORELLI
utterances.utterance: I think they are very fractured. You have the likes of Maxine Waters and then you have those who are the left of the left that are running on a really socialist agenda. And so when you look at the Trump economy, the roll back in taxes and regulations as a pro-growth economic environment, there are not enough people for jobs. I mean, something is really happening here in America where America's first agenda is working.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: All right. So Doug, you are a pollster.

utterances.speaker: SCHOEN
utterances.utterance: I am, indeed.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Well, talk to me about this alleged blue wave that is precedent -- precedence, I should say.

utterances.speaker: SCHOEN
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And the Dems believe is going to happen.

utterances.speaker: SCHOEN
utterances.utterance: Well, I don't see the blue wave, I think the Democrats are ahead the generic voters about six or seven points which would translate into somewhere between 23, 25, or maybe 27 seats. That's no blue wave. I would make the argument that if the Republicans get sidetracked themselves by talking about shutting down the government and don't run on the economy than they are doing we, Democrats a big favor. Talking about tax cuts for the rich unilaterally, another big favor. They talk about the economic consequences of this administration, it gets tougher and tougher for we, Democrats.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK. And Deneen, if the -- if the Maxine's and -- last question -- and the Ocasio-Cortez, what do they say? How does the Democrat run?

utterances.speaker: BORELLI
utterances.utterance: Well, if they're going to keep doubling down on the rhetoric, Judge Jeanine.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: On what?

utterances.speaker: BORELLI
utterances.utterance: And they get -- of anything from the race card to sexism to the child card--

utterances.speaker: SCHOEN
utterances.utterance: How about socialism?

utterances.speaker: BORELLI
utterances.utterance: -- anything they could come up with identity and that as well, socialism as well. So we're going to see even more of that because of what the effects of we're seeing, the results from the Trump economy.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK. OK. Doug, really last question. Do you think the millennials even know what socialism is?

utterances.speaker: SCHOEN
utterances.utterance: I think they know that the game is a much tougher one than when you and I were coming up, and they are looking for solutions and blaming somebody else and asking for redistribution, is their answer. And to me, it's a false answer. Capitalism to me is the answer.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Doug, capitalism.

utterances.speaker: SCHOEN
utterances.utterance: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Deneen Borelli and Doug Schoen, thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: SCHOEN
utterances.utterance: Thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Coming up, more of this special edition of Hannity, right after the break.
